content.description: This route has a rather difficult start (crux) for a 5.9+ rated climb. The lower section of crack does not protect well and is a bit awkward. Upon setting your first solid piece (right where a great finger hold is) cast off for the fun stuff. Make sure it is solid as hell because to pull means to deck rock below, not dirt). HB offsets ruled the rock! After pulling the crux, the route eases up considerably.....With the other routes near, west facing rock, rare to find people there....recommended!
content.protection: small nuts/cams (offset nut works great but a regular nut works as well) for the crux at the start to a couple of mid size pieces after. No rap anchors. Build by slinging or use pro. Short route so minimal pro is all that is needed.

climbs.name: Good Grief
climbs.fa: Karl Mueller & Alan Nelson, December 1981  FL: Dave Mayville

content.description: As I have written on another TOP ROPE route on this very formation, due to it being a TR I feel that too many details would really ruin the fun. But I will say, it is thin and takes some thinking. Face climb!
content.protection: This is a TOP ROPE route so a standard rack, some long slings/webbing etc is all that is needed.

content.description: This short 5.2 is a bit loose. NOT RECOMMENDED AS A LEAD for beginners... But a nice easy solo and downclimb!
content.protection: This is not a good route to Trad lead on in my opinion. But it is a way to access two of the other routes if you wish to top rope them. It is also a fun little solo and a way back down from leading if you so choose.

content.description: good holds/edges. Short route. Decent route with some decent moves. Going with how Randy rates it, one out of five stars. Not a bomb for sure.
content.protection: small to medium pro. No anchors so build it yourself.

content.description: This route has some really cool, thin moves. Have at it! Being a Top Rope route I don't want to add anything else except, check it out!
content.protection: This route is top roped. Slinging boulders or use of pro will work just fine.
